definitions.definition: The belief system of the members of the Religious Society of Friends , an ostensibly Christian religious denomination that began in England in the 17th century.
A behaviour, belief, etc. that is characteristic of Quakers .

main_definition: The belief system of the members of the Religious Society of Friends , an ostensibly Christian religious denomination that began in England in the 17th century.
secondary_definitions: ( derogatory ) A behaviour, belief, etc. that is characteristic of Quakers .
